title: 114_s2244
content: The "Assisting Family Farmers through Insurance Reform Measures Act" or the "AFFIRM Act" includes provisions such as adjusted gross income and per person limitations on share of insurance premiums, cap on reimbursements for administrative expenses, renegotiation of Standard Reinsurance Agreement, cap on overall rate of return for crop insurance providers, prohibition on premium subsidy for harvest price policies, and disclosure of crop insurance premium subsidies in the public interest. Section 508(e)(1) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include payment authority, adjusted gross income limitation, and per person limitation on insurance premiums. The average adjusted gross income limit is set at $250,000, and the maximum payment per person or legal entity is $40,000 per reinsurance year. SEC. 3. CAP ON REIMBURSEMENTS FOR ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATING EXPENSES OF CROP INSURANCE PROVIDERS. Section 508(k)(4) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include an additional cap on reimbursements for administrative and operating costs. Total reimbursements for the 2015 reinsurance year for all types of policies and plans of insurance shall not exceed $900,000,000, with adjustments for subsequent years based on inflation factors. The 2011 Standard Reinsurance Agreement includes a cap on operating costs. SEC. 4. RENEGOTIATION OF STANDARD REINSURANCE AGREEMENT. Section 508(k)(8) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended by striking subparagraph (F). SEC. 5. CAP ON OVERALL RATE OF RETURN FOR CROP INSURANCE PROVIDERS. Section 508(k)(3) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include a cap on the overall rate of return for crop insurance providers. SEC. 6. PROHIBITION ON PREMIUM SUBSIDY FOR HARVEST PRICE POLICIES. SEC. 6 prohibits premium subsidies for harvest price policies starting in 2016 reinsurance year. Section 502(c)(2) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to require the Secretary to disclose the names of individuals or entities receiving federally subsidized crop insurance policies annually. Premium subsidy amounts must also be made public. The amendment to Section 502(c)(2) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act mandates the disclosure of names of individuals or entities receiving federally subsidized crop insurance policies annually. This includes revealing the amount of premium subsidy received and the Federal portion of indemnities paid in case of a loss. Additionally, private insurance providers must disclose underwriting gains earned through the program and the amount paid for administrative purposes under this subtitle. The Secretary is required to disclose administrative and operating expenses, Federal indemnities and reinsurance, and any other purposes. However, information regarding individuals and entities covered by a catastrophic risk protection plan under section 508(b) cannot be disclosed.
